result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered IF defendant is revoked in Case 14CF280,. DOC is ordered to take all financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by the DOC through extended supervision in 14CF280.

consecutive to any other sentence.  By the Court's own calculations and by order of this court, this sentence is TIME SERVED DISPOSITIOON.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Lavell Perkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Antonio Lavell Perkins
Current: 2451A S. 7TH STREET, Milwaukee, WI 53215-3226 United States  (Effective: 03-10-2016)
Prior: 1128 South 32nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in court with attorney Annamarie A. Wineke.  Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Statements made as to sentencing.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other time with credit for 112 DAYS time served.  By the courts' calculations and by order of this court this sentence is TIME SERVED.

Defendant ordered to pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of probation period ordered in case 14CF280- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.  If revoked in case 14CF280, the Court ordered all financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample if not previously done so- pay surcharge.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Annamarie A. Wineke in court, defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay for Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing.  The Court unable to hear this matter on today due to lateness of the hour.  New date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  The Court ordered SCRAM.   

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in court with attorney Annamarie A. Wineke.  Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.   The Court addresses bail as there is no bail order at this time.  Argument of the parties heard.  The Court orders $2500 prb with turn over to Justice Point.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Later same morning......  Attorney Wineke contacted via telephone to inform her that the defendant is in custody.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests projected plea date.

Attorney Annamarie A. Wineke in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Wineke indicates the defendant is out of custody and bail hearing is not needed.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel does not appear.  Per PD's office, another court notice needs to be sent.  If counsel fails to appear on next date, court may elect to remove counsel from the case and have PD's office appoint new counsel.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the Safety Building.  Case set for bail/bond hearing on 8-4-14, 8:30.  Later same day, defense counsel appears.  Defendant has another case before Br. 21 on 8-12-14, 8:30; case rescheduled to that date for possible global resolution.
Bail/bond hearing on July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant served; original in court.  Case set for bail/bond hearing on 7-28-14, 8:30.  Attorney Wineke notified via written Notice of Hearing (voicemail full); DA's office notified via e-mail.  alp
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Annamarie A Wineke in court.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Bail not forfeited at this time.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in court with attorney Annamarie A Wineke.  Antonella Aleman for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any illegal drugs.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5-7-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
